user_request: see creations saved in the google photos
screen_desc: The screenshot shows a photo management app interface, likely Google Photos. The main content indicates there are no photos available, with a prompt to take a picture. Below, there are navigation options for "Photos," "Albums," "Assistant," and "Sharing." The top bar allows users to search their photos, and the camera icon hints at taking new photos.
history_actions: click on the Photos app located at the upper left.
click on the "Confirm" button located at the bottom of screen.
click on the menu icon (often represented by three horizontal lines, also known as the "hamburger" icon) located at the top left.
click on the "Settings" located at the middle left.
click on the back button "<-" located at the top-left.

think_action.Thought: The user wants to see their creations saved in Google Photos. Since I am currently on the main screen and there are no visible photos, I should check the 'Albums' tab as it often contains saved creations like collages, animations, and edited photos.
Future Action Plan: Locate and open the 'Creations' or a similar folder
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Click on the 'Albums' tab located at the bottom of the screen.
